quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh my God! I can't believe it! I jut won an art contest! [Erin screams, Pam and Jim look at each other, Dwight, laughing, gets up and hands her some money]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [whispering] Thanks. I still don't understand why you wanted me to say that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughs hysterically] I got her!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Not cool, Dwight. [Dwight continues laughing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not cool. [Dwight still laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [caught by camera crew dancing to "At the Car Wash", but laughing] Oh, no. I still have the lease on the Michael Scott Paper Company, so occasionally I will sneak down here for a little coffee and dancing. I actually dance all the time. Tip-toeing around corporate - it is a ballet. When I am breaking all the rules, I am break dancing. And expresso.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Guys, I'm scared. I'm really scared. I think I'm growing into a giant. Because look at this normal sized coffee cup. Looks so tiny in my giant hand now. Anybody want to go to lunch with me later on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. How about a woman? Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, I can't do lunch. I was just sending you an email. Jim and I need to leave early today to meet with our contractor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, really? Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just sent it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What about the rest of you? [complete silence]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: At Dunder-Mifflin there is a very strict no lunch with the boss policy and I don't know who instituted it. I think it started right after my predecessor stepped down, but at the Michael Scott Paper Company I really enjoyed having lunch with Pam and Ryan everyday. So, rules be damned, I wanna have lunch with these people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who else? Who else? Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I don't do lunch. I'm eating five small meals a day now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Now that I'm back to doing the job of a temp, again, I find that food is one thing I can control.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. Anyone? Anyone? At all? Accounting? I am accounting on you to go to lunch with me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. I don't want to stay late to have a two hour lunch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael, we have a lot of work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ugh! God! What happened to you people? [talking like a robot] We are just office drones. We are office drones. All we do is work... is work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: If you don't take out his battery, he just keeps going all day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, no. Your battery fell out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [still talking like a robot] I... was just learning... to... love.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hi, guys. How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Erin, how many times do I have to tell you? It is not necessary for you to ask us how we are doing every time you interact with us.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Right. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs] Now, how can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Did somebody here leave a map in the printer to Youngstown, Ohio?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Attention, office. Who here is planning a trip to Youngstown, Ohio? I will take your silence to mean that you are all hiding something. This location is the Superior Court -

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So someone is going to a court. Big deal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It is a big deal. Cause there's only a handful of reasons why someone would ever go to a courthouse in Ohio and not be charged with a crime. To claim an inheritance from a deceased relative. To obtain a learner's permit at age 14 and a half instead of 15. Erin, let me see your birth certificate.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There are other reasons to go to Ohio.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We're getting married today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, it turns out it's the closest place to get a marriage license without a 3 day waiting period.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Tell 'em how it happened.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok. So, we're going through all the wedding plans and, boy, it is complicated.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And very expensive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Very expensive. Cause you say you want a small wedding and that's great but then you have to invite -

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You can't leave anyone out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok, just get to the good part.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok. Right. Oh, so this morning we are having breakfast together and I just looked up from my cereal and I said, " You know what I want to do today? I want to marry you."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I had just woken up. I didn't look cute. That's how I knew he meant it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Michael? Michael sorry to bother you. Are you going to be working down here? Do you want these down here now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No work. No work. No work. I come in here to release frustration. Ooh. Ah. Ah. Ah. Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, I like to swim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You have a cool place to come hang.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If you ever want to come down here, door's always open, lock's broken, so...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on in. Hey, hey, hey. Here we go. Here we go. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now you got it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Now I do got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now you got it. Hey, you want some espresso?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You gotta keep yourself dehydrated.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: That's rule #1.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. I love it. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Whew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Guys, I believe that I have figured out what is up your butts. There's no reason to be scared. The bad man is gone.Charles is gone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Charles really did a number on these guys. They are way too focused on work. When I was in charge, this place was like Dave and Buster's People just hanging out, having, fun, eating apps. I don't know. It's like [pause] Dave died or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Daddy's here and daddy is going to take care of you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Please don't refer to yourself as our daddy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am your big daddy and I am gonna kiss da boo boo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [baby voice] Wittle Andy is afwaid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Andy's afwaid?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you all afwaid?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Daddy's here for you. My wittle angels. Ok. I think that I have figured a way to get you guys out of your funk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Funk is the problem and the solution.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That makes sense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I've taken my downstairs office and I have turned it into a place to hang out. A place where unattractive and attractive people can get together. To meet. To greet. To see the ones that you love. To love the ones that you see.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Is this our punishment for not wanting to have lunch with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't you get over lunch, Oscar? Everybody else is past it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Jack Nicholson impression] All work and no play makes Michael a dull boy.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: This is like a haunted coffeehouse thing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. Dwight is confusing you. That - it's, it's more of a disco.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It's like a haunted disco.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ... with coffee but without the haunted.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It's a combo dance house coffee bar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's a daytime disco on the ground floor of and industrial office building.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: It's a cafe disco.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: So, like, a disco cafe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wha - No. No. Not even close. I can't force you to go down but I can entice you. I'm gonna be down there. Erin will be down there from time to time... and all-you-can-eat espresso.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, Kevin, I guess it is just me and you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Holdin' down the fort.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. This place is great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, my God, Kevin. I am still on hold. You were supposed to get the answer from Michael and come back up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is a no work zone. Please respect the lei.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. Respect the lei.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Come.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kevin, stay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Kevin, come.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kevin, stay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Kevin, come.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stay, stay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Come on, right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cookie. Kevin, cookie.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ugh. There is no cookie, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [to Michael] Is there a cookie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Wha -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, for goodness sakes, Kevin. There's no cookie. There's no cookie. Come on. Come.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I wanted a cookie.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Completely unacceptable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now I know what the founders of Phillip-Morris felt like. you just want to give people a smooth, fun way to relax and suddenly you're just some terrible monster.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Michael is holding the stereo speaker up to a vent - blaring "[Gonna Make You Sweat] Everybody Dance Now", spins in chair] Oww!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Aw, what the hell? [goes to Vance Refrigeration] Hi, Jessica. Is Bob in?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.line: Oh, he's on a call.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, I'll just duck my head in.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.line: It's pretty important. He wouldn't want to be disturbed. Can I give him a message before he gets off?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Tell him I'm going dancing downstairs in the storage closet between the bathrooms that used to be a utility shower and he should join me there.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.line: I'll let him know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey. I like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [starts dancing with Phyllis] Alright. Back. There you are. There you go. Good. Good. Ooh. Show me some attitude.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh! Mother ******!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, God! No! No! No! No! No!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Back!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, wow! What did you do?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [moans in pain]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You didn't do that. You're ok. You're ok. Let's lie down. You want to go down? Alright.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Wow! Sorry!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. That's ok. That's not a problem. Ok, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey! Hey, hey, hey! I got your text. Who's Phillip?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. No. No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who tipped you over? Was it Phillip?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It's my back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's her back. We just - We need - Let's - You know what?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Call a doctor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're going to take care of you. We're gonna get you help. Let's - come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No. Call Bob.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, no. No. No. This is no good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah. Back injuries are common. Not as common as knee injuries but more common than wrist injuries.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't need you to give me a history lesson. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you think history is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's just, we need to get her out of here because no one is going to want to go in there with a woman writhing around on the floor. Wait, wait, wait. But most importantly we need to get her some medical attention. ASAP. Stat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [barging through office door] Alright. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Out of the way! Move it or lose it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You having fun?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, my God! What happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What? Oh, just having to much fun. Phyllis, we're going to put you in here. Dwight's going to take care of you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What? No. I thought we were going to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You want to get sick you go to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, Dwight. Ok. Good. I do not want anyone to worry.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What happened to Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, you know. Nohting. She's  - we were hanging out at Cafe Disco and she had a flare up of am existing injury. But she's a tough, old bird. So...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Can you please go back to work instead of masterminding these situations were in we hurt ourselves?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. Phyllis did injure herself. But she injured herself having fun and I don't think she would trade that memory for anything. [Phyllis can be heard screaming in the backgroud]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I would like the memory of a day uninterrupted by this nonsense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You all took a life here today. you did. The life of the party. Erin?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want you to go downstairs and I want you to shut it down.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Like unplug the coffee machine and bring it up here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't care. Bury it. I hope you're happy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [exits the conference room in an undershirt] I'm gonna need two able bodied men.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Cafe Disco? More like Crappe Disco.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You're bad. [they turn off the lights and turn on music - start dancing]

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy 1
quotes.line: There's girl in there.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy 2
quotes.line: Where?

quotes.speaker: VRG 1
quotes.line: The other room?

quotes.speaker: VRG 2
quotes.line: What other room?

quotes.speaker: VRG 1
quotes.line: Down the hall.

quotes.speaker: VRG 2
quotes.line: There's girls in there?

quotes.speaker: VRG 1
quotes.line: What'd I just say?

quotes.speaker: VRG 2
quotes.line: You have another sandwich?

quotes.speaker: VRG 1
quotes.line: Forget the sandwich. Girls. Girls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I guess they got what they want. I am eating alone. Might as well be dinner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You comfy? Alright? Alright. Relax. Relax, ok?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Dwight! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on. Relax. The shirt wasn't doing you any favors. If my assessment in correct, you grind your teeth?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No kidding! She sits three feet from me. It's the most annoying thing. [mimics grinding teeth] It's like children singing Christmas carols.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah! I love the vibe down here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Ashley! You made it!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You invited someone?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. Was I not allowed to do that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I've been here 8 years and I've never... [Erin walks away] Rude.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm not sure, but I'm pretty sure I'm in a dance off. Alright!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cafe Disco is dead but I can still hear the music in my head.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I hear it, too, Boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's better than I imagined it!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: That feels good, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Tell me where it hurts.

quotes.speaker: Phylis
quotes.line: Right... mmmm... right there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh yeah. you've got a knot in your crest. This remedy has been passed down in my family for generations. and it always works. My grandfather was told that Diamond Dancer would never race again. they were wrong. He came in 9th in the Apple Creek Derby and his jerky came in 3rd the following year. A majestic beast. So fast. So tender.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Welcome, welcome! Cafe Disco. I am Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey, Angela! Welcome to -

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Stop!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Angela. Angela. Angela. May I interest you in a triple espresso or perhaps a dance?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. I didn't come down here to get wet and wild. I just need you to sign these.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh. Alright. There you go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. You need to sign them all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. No. No. Here is the deal - one signature for every song.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Look, I hate to be "that" person but I just don't like the general spirit of music.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know. I know, Angela. A lot of people doubted Cafe Disco at first but it is a magical place. You have to give it a chance. If these walls could tale they would say, " This is a magical place! You are safe here. We have talking walls. We're not going to eat you." [Angela shows Michael the papers again] No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is oil from the gland of an otter. It keeps their fur water resistant, as well as traps heat. Now I need you to lie still for an hour.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: An hour? I can't stay here an hour.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Whoa! Whoa, whoa, girl. Whoa. Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Boss, this used to hang from my windshield but it belongs in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, thank you, Creed. you're really getting this place.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: No problem. I'll just have no idea who's driving behind me now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm gonna with the python.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: But the rattler's so scary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Please. I find the rattle soothing. It puts me to sleep.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I think Bob is gonna cheat on me with his new secretary. [she starts to giggle]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What's so funny?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: When I say it out loud it's so silly. [they both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! Hey! Angela, no! No cleaning up!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You are forcing me to be down here. Am I not allowed to have some fun?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No... cleaning... up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [waiting outside the bathroom for Pam, he is holding a hand-picked bouquet of flowers and pacing] These are for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They're beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We should probably stop by. It'd mean a lot to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! Hey! Jim and Pam! Can you believe this? It's really happening.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Wanna dance, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ordinarily I would say no but you need to move to reduce lactic acid build-up. Also, this song is fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Mind if I steal my wife?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You can't steal what is legally your property.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Are those staples?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This dance competition is not over.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What dance competition? I was just dancin' casual with my friends, y'all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You guys are the best for coming. You don't have to stay if you don't want to. I understand.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We're gonna stay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. At least for one more dance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, no. Not me. Not me. Get out of here. Cafe Disco! [Dwight hits Michael in ear] Hey! Come on, man. It's not even to "Y".

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This is so cheesy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I like cheesy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Me, too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. I think maybe I want a "wedding" wedding.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Me, too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Would you like to dance?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. [Camera pans to down to show her swinging her foot to the music]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. No. Well, ok.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Stop squirming.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, stop trying to poke me with a sharp thing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You wanted to do this. Just be brave.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I, I - but you're not a professional and I'm thinking maybe we should have gone to a professional.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I'm doing it. No. I'm doing it for free. You have to stop squirming otherwise I'm gonna mess up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you sure that's not the "gay" ear?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Gay ear? Are you 12 years old?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, I...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Look, I'm gonna count to 3.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Count to twen - count to twenty.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No. I'm gonna count to 3.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: K

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Agh! Son of a bitch!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Andy, that was just the ice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It was?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah. It was.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: Hey, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hi. Did you have bacon for breakfast?

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh...cause you smell like bacon.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: I didn't think I did. How's everything going?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Tight. I'm going down the hall to this office to see Michael - there's free espressos.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I would invite you but I remember that you just want to be friends.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: We can still...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Are you sure that you didn't eat bacon?

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh. Whatever it is I like it. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.line: Yes, I had some bacon this morning. I just didn't think it was anyone's business.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I love the smell of bacon on a woman.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey, Lynn, it's Kevin. I was thinking about going and getting a coffee at the Cafe Disco, wondering if you want to go with. Bye. Angela, my stomach is really hurting.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Just go down, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: My grandpa was the funnest guy I ever knew. He would sing. He would dance. He would....fall down. But then...he started going to these meetings and everything changed. He...stopped going out at night. He got a job. The fun just dried up. It was really sad. I don't want that to happen to you guys. I'm not gonna let it happen.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: How did I end up back in Crazytown?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It is hard to imagine you playing softball.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I was all-county my junior and senior years.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh yeah? Big deal. I once hit three home runs against Little Flower Catholic.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: The girls school?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I played high school softball. Notice I didn't say "girls" high school softball. Not after the landmark case of Shrute vs. the Lackawanna County Board of Education.That was one case the Pennsylvania Supreme Court got right. I hit the ball right over the protest banners.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sarcastically] Oh, no. I love Ohio. Next time you're there say "Hi" to my cousin Amel and then kick him in the groin area because he's a cheat and a ball hog. And if he's still married to Clarissa, kick her in the groin area, too. 'Cause she's a heart breaking tart...and a ball hog.
